abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Francistown Urban
            Development Project for Botswana was successful. The project
            achieved its objectives, its impact on institutional
            development has been substantial, sustainability is likely,
            and the performance of both the Bank and Borrower was
            satisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, it is important to have realistic estimates
            of the timing required for implementation, particularly
            regarding startup and the completion of detailed design and
            engineering. Second, it was difficult to establish both the
            appropriate institutional capacities for implementing new
            policies, as well as the associated requirements for
            preparing, implementing, and managing urban projects.
            Finally, constraints were experienced with implementing
            policies which hinged on the introduction of untested
            enabling legislation.
